2001-12-31T12:00:00 2001-12-31 T12:00:00
Ctrl + J / Ctrl + Shift + J : Inline search, meaning you can type on the fly to search text in current editor. You can use Up/Down arrow keys to navigate between matching text fragment in forward/reverse direction. This is one of the most powerful features you will find in advanced editors like Vim or Emacs.
2. Ctrl + K/ Ctrl + Shift + K : Search next selected text in forward or reverse direction.
3. Ctrl + L : Go to line.
4. Ctrl + Alt + Up/Down : Very useful in repeatative assignment statements.
5. Alt + Up/Down : Move current line up or down. Also, very handy to select current line.
6. Ctrl + . OR , : This is contextual and may be specific to Java editors: if you have error or warnings in current file in editor it will navigate to them.
